member.name: M:Xamarin.InsightsCore.IOWriter.ReadRawDiskImage(System.String)
member.summary: Reads an image from disk in a portable way - will not decompress compressed images

member.name: M:Xamarin.InsightsCore.IOWriter.ReadDiskImage(System.String)
member.summary: Reads an image from disk in a portable way - also will decompress images that require decompression

member.name: T:Xamarin.InsightsCore.NetworkAvailability
member.summary: One big state machine for network availability, with allowances for overrides. It is expected to have its NetworkState set by platform specific codebases signalling changes in their network state.

member.name: T:Xamarin.InsightsCore.States.FuzzyNetworkState
member.summary: Basically every platform has a different idea of network states and trying to represent the specifics of each one is a pita. so lets just be fuzzy and use abstract concepts, trying to match the platform specific concepts to them as best we can

member.name: M:Xamarin.InsightsCore.WebApi.SubmitException(System.Exception,Xamarin.Insights.Severity,System.String)
member.summary: Submits an exception to our api server, this runs through the crash api

member.name: M:Xamarin.InsightsCore.WebApi.SubmitExceptionAndSave(System.Exception,Xamarin.Insights.Severity,System.String)
member.summary: Submits an exception to our api server, this runs through the crash api, in addition this will save the current state of the journal to disk this entire method will block. It is intended to be used when in an unhandled event handler

member.name: T:Xamarin.ReportSeverity
member.summary: Obsolete, use Xamarin.Insights.ReportSeverity instead

member.name: F:Xamarin.ReportSeverity.Warning
member.summary: A Warning

member.name: F:Xamarin.ReportSeverity.Error
member.summary: An Error

member.name: T:Xamarin.Insights
member.summary: Xamarin.Insights

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Initialize(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method initializes Insights and starts automatic monitoring systems, it is required to be called before any other API
member.param: The APIKey given to you by Insights, which can be found here: https://insights.xamarin.com/app/$YourAppNameGoesHere$/settings
The current version of your app, this should use Semantic Versioning
An identifier that uniquely identifies your app, a unique string of some kind
An opetional paramater that allows you to specify a unique cache directory for insights to use

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.PurgeAllPendingData
member.summary: Attempts to purge all pending data, this may not actually send all data to the web service if networking is down or insights is unavailable.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Insights.HasPendingCrashReportEventHandler
member.summary: A delegate for the HasPendingCrashReportEventHandler event, you are expected to call Insights.PurgePendingCrashReports() in this method if you wish for Insights to synchronously send a crash report on startup, otherwise ignore this and insights will send the crash report in the background.

member.name: E:Xamarin.Insights.HasPendingCrashReport
member.summary: This event is fired when Insights detects a new pending crash report

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.DebugModeKey
member.summary: Passing this key into will enable a silent debug mode in Insights. Insights will not track, catch exceptions or submit information of any kind. This is useful if you are trying to debug your application and want Insights to get out of the way.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.IsInitialized
member.summary: This paramater will return true if Initialize has been successfully called

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.DisableCollectionTypes
member.summary: This paramater allows you to disable certain collection types, they will not be reported to the Insights server.

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Traits.Avatar
member.summary: URL corresponding to the location of the users avatar

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Traits.DateOfBirth
member.summary: Use Date.ToString('o'); to encode the users date of birth

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Traits.CreatedAt
member.summary: Use Date.ToString('o'); to encode the date the user created the account

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.DisableCollection
member.summary: DisableCollection allows you to disable Insights at run time, it will not collect information, it will not submit information, any information it has collected will be preserved. Crash reporting is also disabled if this flag is set, use at your own risk.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.DisableDataTransmission
member.summary: DisableDataTransmission allows you to disable any use of data communication by Insights, when this value is set to True Insights will just gather data and not send any data.

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.DisableExceptionCatching
member.summary: DisableExceptionCatching disables any automatic unhandled exception handling in Insights. Use this if you wish to catch exceptions yourself and .Report() them to insights at your leisure

member.name: P:Xamarin.Insights.ForceDataTransmission
member.summary: Setting this property to true will force Insights to submit data to the server regardless of the network state

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Identify(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Identify is used to identify your users with unique information, this also allows Insights to attach other reports to this user.
member.param: The unique identifier for this user, this can be whatever string you like as long as it is unique for that user, using DeviceIDs and such is not recommended, those are only unique to devices
A Generic table of information you would like to associate with this user.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Identify(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Identify is used to identify your users with unique information, this also allows Insights to attach other reports to this user. This method is a shorthand version of Identify(string, IDictionary) in that it essentially represents a table with one value
member.param: The unique identifier for this user, this can be whatever string you like as long as it is unique for that user, using DeviceIDs and such is not recommended, those are only unique to devices
The key representing a key/value storage type.
The value representing a key/value storage type.
member.example:
This sample shows how to call the method with a key/value.
Insights.Identify("YourUsersUniqueId", "Email", "njpatel@catfacts.com");

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Track(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Track allows you to track usage of your application and add additional data to each event
member.param: A unique name for this event
An optional key/value store representing additional data that you would like to attach to this event

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Track(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Track allows you to track usage of your application and add additional data to each event
member.param: A unique name for this event
A trait for this track event, key value form of the Dictionary varient
Value for the given trait, key value form of the Dictionary varient

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.TrackTime(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: TrackTime allows you to track events that make take an amount of time to complete. For example measuring how long it takes to submit login information to a remote server.
member.param: A unique identifier name for this event
member.returns: a handler object that allows you to start and stop the built in timer.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.TrackTime(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: TrackTime allows you to track events that make take an amount of time to complete. For example measuring how long it takes to submit login information to a remote server.
member.param: A unique identifer name for this event
member.returns: a handler object that allows you to start and stop the built in timer.

member.name: T:Xamarin.Insights.Severity
member.summary: Describes the Severity of a Report

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Severity.Warning
member.summary: Warning Severity

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Severity.Error
member.summary: Error Severity, you are not expected to call this from client side code unless you have disabled unhandled exception handling.

member.name: F:Xamarin.Insights.Severity.Critical
member.summary: Critical Severity

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Report(System.Exception,Xamarin.Insights.Severity)
member.summary: Report allows you to report exceptions to Insights when they are caught, this allows you to track exceptions without crashing.
member.param: an Exception data type, you can also attach extra data to the .Data paramater of the exception
A warning level for the given report, can be ReportSeverity.Warning or ReportSeverity.Error

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Report(System.Exception,System.Collections.IDictionary,Xamarin.Insights.Severity)
member.summary: An overload of Report, this allows you to specify extra data to be sent with the exception.
member.param: The Exception you want to report
A Dictionary containing key/values that you want to report along with the exception
A warning level for the given report, can be ReportSeverity.Warning or ReportSeverity.Error

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Report(System.Exception,System.String,System.String,Xamarin.Insights.Severity)
member.summary: An overload of Report, this allows you to specify a single key/value pair of extra data to be sent with the exception
member.param: The Exception you want to report
A warning level for the given report, can be ReportSeverity.Warning or ReportSeverity.Error

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.Save
member.summary: Save is intended to be called when your process is being stopped. It informs Insights that the process will no longer be active and lets Insights save its state to disk. Insights auto detects most cases where this would happen, The intendted use case for this is if you are handling unhandled exceptions yourself, you will need to Insights.Save() after reporting your exceptions.
member.returns: Returns a task, it is recommended that you await this task.

member.name: M:Xamarin.Insights.PurgePendingCrashReports
member.summary: Purges any pending crash reports. This is only ever intended to be used when Insights notifies you that there are pending crash reports.
member.returns: A Task that should be awaited until it has completed, signifying that the crash reports have been delivered to insights web.

member.name: T:Xamarin.ITrackHandle
member.summary: Interface for TrackHandles, this not expected to be implimented by client side code

member.name: M:Xamarin.ITrackHandle.Start
member.summary: Starts the TrackTime handle

member.name: M:Xamarin.ITrackHandle.Stop
member.summary: Stops the TrackTime handle

member.name: P:Xamarin.ITrackHandle.Data
member.summary: the key value traits list associated with this TrackTime event
